intro: Cyperus camerunensis, commonly known as the Cameroon flatsedge, is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly Cameroon, and thrives in moist, swampy habitats. Cyperus camerunensis is often found in wetlands and along water bodies, contributing to the ecological diversity of these environments.
